title: Health Education and Nature-Integrated Collaborative Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Preservice teachers explore the interconnectedness of health education and nature, focusing on designing educational activities that consider safety and risk management. Conducted through a hybrid model combining online tools (Zoom, Padlet, etc.) and face-to-face collaboration.

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more connections between health education activities and the natural environment.

Over 2–4 weeks, learners collaborate with 3–5 team members while adhering to safety standards (e.g., school practicum safety manuals) and nature-based education principles (e.g., ecological sensitivity activities), drafting one health education activity plan and achieving ≥4/5 in peer and instructor rubrics (creativity, safety, nature integration, collaboration).
Learners revise and improve their designed activities to over 80% completion through peer feedback and instructor evaluation.

resources: Victoria State Health Education Curriculum Materials (Australia)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
